subject_classification.parameter: Risk Group C (presence of TOD/CCD or DM)

scenario_choice.name: on two or three anti-hypertensive drugs

action.name: assumption no systolic or diastolic BP message
action.message: We did not find a BP in the vitals signs section of the computer. We are not at present able to use the BP recorded in the text of the progress note, so we are not able to determine whether the BP control is adequate or inadequate. Please enter BP using the top part of the screen.

action.name: alpha blocker orthostasis
action.message: This patient has an active prescription for an alpha adrenergic antagonist. We assume that you have checked the patient's standing blood pressure and that the patient does not have orthostasis (for example, SBP drop >20 mmHg).

action.name: test parameterized message
action.message: It is false that 7.3 inches of rain fell yesterday, and the patient is taking the following drugs: furosemide, Insulin, simvastatin, tamsulosin, terazosin, triamterene

action.name: Medication dose above upper limit
action.message: The dose of terazosin is above the upper limit for management of hypertension. Please check if prescription information is accurate.

action.name: ATHENA HTN Disclaimer
action.message: The clinical information from this system is advisory only and is intended to supplement the knowledge of health care professionals regarding the management of hypertension. It is not intended to replace sound clinical judgment or individualized patient care in delivery of healthcare services. Although the ATHENA-HTN information is derived from research literature and is subject to review, we cannot guarantee its comprehensiveness or currency. Please note that medical information is dynamic due to ongoing research and clinical experience and is subject to interpretation. There is also the possibility of errors in the programming. The user of this software assumes sole responsibility for any decisions made or actions taken based the information contained in this software, including but not limited to therapeutic suggestions. ATHENA-HTN, the Department of Veterans Affairs and Stanford University shall have no liability to any person, or entity with regard to claims, loss, or damage caused, or alleged to be caused, directly or indirectly by the use of this software or the information contained within. ATHENA-HTN is the property of Stanford's Office Technology Licensing (OTL) and Department of Veterans Affairs. By accessing ATHENA-HTN, you agree use ATHENA-HTN only as a reference resource for research. You agree to abstain from using ATHENA-HTN to generate knowledge for treatment.

action.name: substitution message
action.message: Based on most recent BP in the database, BP appears to be adequately controlled; however, ALTERNATIVE DRUGS may be preferred.

action.name: NO ADE recommended drug
action.message: No adverse reactions are listed for the antihypertensive drug(s) we are recommending. If the patient has had an adverse reaction, please enter it in a progress note entitled "Adverse Reactions/Allergy".

replacing_activity_evaluation.name: (non-DHP) Calcium Channel Blocker
replacing_activity_evaluation.relative_indications: CKD by eGFR or ICD9 codes

action.name: heart failure and ndhp
action.message: Patient has heart failure which is a relative contraindication to diltiazem. Evaluate potential benefit versus harm of initiating diltiazem. Follow clinically.

action.name: heart block and add ndhp
action.message: Patient has heart block which is a relative contraindication to diltiazem. Evaluate potential benefit versus harm of initiating diltiazem. Follow clinically.
action.rule_in_criteria: presence of heart block (2nd or 3rd degree)

action.name: Atrial fibrillation and add NDHP orBB
action.message: Management of arrythmia is complex and may require consultation with specialist.

action.name: disclaimer about procedure reports delete
action.message: Diagnoses from EKG reports are not extracted. If patient has an arrythmia that is not shown in patient summary, please update problem list.

replacing_activity_evaluation.name: (non-DHP) Calcium Channel Blocker
replacing_activity_evaluation.relative_indications: CKD by eGFR or ICD9 codes

action.name: heart failure and ndhp
action.message: Patient has heart failure which is a relative contraindication to diltiazem. Evaluate potential benefit versus harm of initiating diltiazem. Follow clinically.

action.name: heart block and add ndhp
action.message: Patient has heart block which is a relative contraindication to diltiazem. Evaluate potential benefit versus harm of initiating diltiazem. Follow clinically.
action.rule_in_criteria: presence of heart block (2nd or 3rd degree)

action.name: Atrial fibrillation and add NDHP orBB
action.message: Management of arrythmia is complex and may require consultation with specialist.

action.name: disclaimer about procedure reports delete
action.message: Diagnoses from EKG reports are not extracted. If patient has an arrythmia that is not shown in patient summary, please update problem list.

replacing_activity_evaluation.name: ACE Inhibitor
replacing_activity_evaluation.compelling_indications: CKD by eGFR or ICD9 codes

action.name: ACE inhibitor and HF
action.message: Use of ACE inhibitors in patients with heart failure and ejection fraction <0.35 significantly reduces overall mortality and hospital admissions. For patients with ejection fraction >=0.35 ACE inhibitors may be beneficial but this is not established.

action.name: add ACE(2ary prevention HF), dose adjustment
action.message: When adding ACE inhibitor to this patient's therapeutic regime a dose adjustment of other anti-hypertensive drugs may be required.

action.name: adding ace inhibitor, check Cr and K, [Cr<=1.5(male) or Cr<=1.3(female)] and K<5.6
action.message: Check the patient's creatinine and potassium concentrations when prescribing ACE Inhibitors.

action.name: Add ACE/ARB & CKD; alert creatinine rise
action.message: A stable increase of serum creatinine as much as 35% above baseline after ACEI or ARB initiation may be tolerated, as long as hyperkalemia does not occur. ACEI or ARB should be discontinued, or other potentially reversible causes of kidney failure investigated if progressive and rapid rise of serum creatinine continues. Since CKD is associated with progressive rise in creatinine over years, ACEI or ARB should not be discontinued for this situation, since these medications are renoprotective.

action.name: Alpha blocker and dose titration
action.message: To decrease the likelihood of syncope or excessive hypotension treatment should usually be initiated with a dose of 1 or 2 mgs at bedtime. The dose should be increased in a stepwise fashion. Blood pressures should be measured to check for postural drop.

action.name: compelling if symptomatic BPH
action.message: Compellingly indicated if the patient has symptomatic BPH.

replacing_activity_evaluation.name: Cardioselective Beta Blocker
replacing_activity_evaluation.relative_indications: CKD by eGFR or ICD9 codes

action.name: Add Beta blocker and DM
action.message: Beta blockers may diminish symptoms of and recovery from hypoglycemia and should be used with caution in patients who are prone to hypoglycemia.

action.name: Atrial fibrillation and add NDHP orBB
action.message: Management of arrythmia is complex and may require consultation with specialist.

action.name: betablocker dyslipidemia warning message
action.message: Beta blockers may have transient adverse effects on lipids in some patients. Consider repeating lipid profile after maximal dosage of drug has been reached if appropriate.

action.name: disclaimer about procedure reports delete
action.message: Diagnoses from EKG reports are not extracted. If patient has an arrythmia that is not shown in patient summary, please update problem list.

action.name: Add HCTZ/BB diabetes, ACE compellingly indicated if proteinuria
action.message: If patient has proteinuria or renal manifestations of diabetes therapy with ACE inhibitor is strongly recommended.
action.rule_in_criteria: presence of diabetes and ACE not precribed

action.name: DHP add and Angina
action.message: Felodipine is not FDA-Approved for the indication of angina, but by VA guidelines it is the DHP calcium channel antagonist of choice.

replacing_activity_evaluation.name: Thiazide Diuretic
replacing_activity_evaluation.compelling_indications: CKD by eGFR or ICD9 codes

action.name: HCTZ dosing message and creatinine<=2.0
action.message: HCTZ dose above 25 mg doesn't add to BP control for most patients and may lead to hypokalemia.

action.name: Add HCTZ/BB diabetes, ACE compellingly indicated if proteinuria
action.message: If patient has proteinuria or renal manifestations of diabetes therapy with ACE inhibitor is strongly recommended.
action.rule_in_criteria: presence of diabetes and ACE not precribed

action.name: Urinary incontinence and ADD HCTZ
action.message: There is little information about the likelihood that introduction of low-dose thiazides will adversely affect bladder function. Follow individual patient response to treatment.
